result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald M Shoemaker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gerald M Shoemaker in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM88.    Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  $2500.00 sign bond, concurrent, no contact with Rachel Valentine, if Embrace program completed, bond will be amended to no abusive contact,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Each party shall contact Embrace and sign up for the Child exchange program.  Set for 11-29-16 @ 10:00 RH.
Review hearing on November 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Bonds concurrent.  No contact with Rachel Valentine, if Embrace program completed bond will be amended to no abusive contact.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood. Each party shall contact Embrace and sign up for the Child exchange program.
